intro: Sebastiania klotzschiana, commonly known as the Christmas star, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped yellow flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are often used in traditional medicine. Its leaves are alternate and oval, with a smooth texture and a slightly waxy surface. Sebastiania klotzschiana is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant floral display and unique appearance.
